description: Numbers that are divisible only by primes congruent to 3 mod 4.
comments: Numbers whose factorization as Gaussian integers is the same as their factorization as integers. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Oct 14 2005
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
mathematica: ok[1] = True; ok[n_] := And @@ (Mod[#, 4] == 3 &) /@ FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]; Select[Range[251], ok] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, May 05 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) for(n=1,1000,if(sumdiv(n,d,isprime(d)*if((d-3)%4,1,0))==0, print1(n,",")))(PARI) forstep(n=1,999,2,for(j=1,#t=factor(n)[,1],t[j]%4==1&next(2)); print1(n", ")) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 26 2008(MAGMA) [n: n in [1..300] | forall{d: d in PrimeDivisors(n) | d mod 4 eq 3}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 21 2012(Haskell)a004614 n = a004614_list !! (n-1)a004614_list = filter (all (== 1) . map a079261 . a027748_row) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 07 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
